the frame format includes the starting
will be the beginning sequence with 8
bits and then comes the header which is
of 16 bits and then comes the body which
is a variable length body we can define
the size of this body because whatever
we receive from the network layer that

eight bits as the beginning sequence and
the ending sequence 0 1 1 1 1 1 1 0 it
means 0 continue 6 ones and then 0
whenever any frame is created the
starting sequence and the ending
sequence that is the start of the frame
and the end of the frame will be with
this sequence and this beginning
sequence and ending sequence is not only
for the start of the frame and the end
of the frame it also does an additional
functionality and this sequence is also
transmitted during any times that the
link is idle so that the sender and the
receiver can keep their clock
synchronized for example if there are
two nodes and if these two nodes are not
involving in data exchange for a long
time this beginning and ending sequences
will be transmitted at any time just to
synchronize their clocks so that the
link can be allowed and the clocks are

friend
which means supervisory frame and the
